Project.name: AsyncCommand Utility for AS3
Project.Description: The AsyncCommand utility offers a solution to the problem of executing a series of commands each of which may need to complete one or more asynchronous operations before the next command is executed.
Project.ReleaseNotes: Features in Version 1.0 * IAsyncCommand interface defines the methods required for an asynchronous command, which at the moment is only setOnComplete, which sets a callback method for the IAsyncCommand implementer to call when it has completed its task. * AsyncCommand class extends the framework SimpleCommand class and implements IAsyncCommand. * AsyncMacroCommand class extends Notifier and implements IAsyncCommand. Accepts IAsyncCommands or ICommands for subcommands. This means any combination of SimpleCommand, MacroCommand, AsyncCommand or AsyncMacroCommand. * Standard and MultiCore versions included.
Project.Installation: Installing the Project Source Code From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. For instance: c:\development\ * You will see a AsyncCommand_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. For instance: c:\development\AsyncCommand_X_Y From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository. Using the Utility in Your Project Add the Utility Library to your Project Using Flex Builder 3 * Open or create a Flex or AIR Project in Flex Builder 3 * From the Flex Builder menu, do: Project -> Properties -> Flex Build Path -> Library Path -> Add SWC * Browse and select the SWC (for instance: c:\development\AsyncCommand_X_Y\bin\Utility_AS3_AsyncCommand_X_Y.swc) * Click Finish. Add the Utility Library to your Flash/CS3/CS4 Project * The distributed SWC file will not work. * You must place the source code in your classpath. * Consult the CS3/CS4 documentation for the various ways to accomplish this.
